bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Common Interest Community Board became effective on July 1, 2008. The Board was established to regulate Common Interest Community Managers, via a licensure program for management firms, and principal and supervisory employees of the licensed firms. Also included under the Common Interest Community Board are the Condominium Act, the Real Estate Time-Share Act, the Real Estate Cooperative Act, the Property Owners' Association Act, and the Common Interest Community Management Information Fund Act. The programs under the authority of the Common Interest Community Board include: condominium project and time-share project registrations; property owner, condominium, and cooperative associations, and common interest community managers. The Condominium Act and the Real Estate Time-Share Act cover transactions occurring within the Commonwealth, even if the property involved is located outside the Commonwealth.
